name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Respondent, v. Stephen FETTER, Petitioner

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Respondent, v. Stephen FETTER, Petitioner.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 31st day of January, 2002, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED, but LIMITED to the following issue:
1. Whether the Commonwealth failed to comply with the requirements of 18 Pa.C.S.A. § 5704(2)(iv), 5709(3)(vii), and •5710(a)(3) of the Wiretapping and Electronic Surveillance Control Act (the “Act”) and if the Commonwealth failed to comply with the Act, whether such failure should result in the suppression of evidence obtained in violation of the Act.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
790 A.2d 988
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Respondent, v. Stephen FETTER, Petitioner.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Jan. 31, 2002.
